metadata.name: Drei #354
metadata.description:
For Lia Drei (https://www.archivioguerrieridrei.com/biografia-1?lang=en)

This morning I thought about all the work I did with triangles... the idea came to me that the right triangle is the symbol of creation...(…)
The hypotenuse is the love that unites and gives life. The tip of the triangle is the uterus which makes the space grow.
-- LIA DREI (Diaries, 2004)

My paintings have no past, they are empty of meaning in the present, but await the discussions of the future, as remotely as possible.
And this is why they don't have their feet firmly planted in the ground, although there are invisible roots that take life from the earth, like so many blades of grass.
While I work I look for the truth in what I do. The time is not yesterday because it would be false, it is not today because the emotion takes my breath away and I die every moment and am reborn after every new brushstroke.
Soon after, time becomes old, useless, meaningless. I never know what will come out with the next brushstroke or spatula stroke.
My thoughts go at supersonic speed and only stop to choose another color. The one just painted is never the right one. So I live the life of the new painting with the sense of mystery that the moonless night has. (…)
-- LIA DREI (Notes, 1962)

----

I never talk about myself.

I'm not creative.
I blatantly steal other people's art.
I'm a bad coder, I copy, paste, mix ideas.
I often ruin it, degrade it.
But I always make it mine what I like.

I absorb.

-- ALESSANDRO FIORE (fxhash, 2024)


—————

The work is created responsive by default and it will adapt to the browser window. It will change (even consistently in some cases) based on the screen aspect ratio.

Key commands:

1 = Square 2000x2000
2 = Square 4000x4000
3 = Square 6000x6000 (Dependent on your browser limitations, tested on Safari (Mac))
p = Portrait 1500x2115
l = Landscape 2115x1500
e = Responsive/Default
f = Fullscreen
s = Save as image


See LICENSE.txt in live view for licensing details.

metadata.name: seekers #290
metadata.description:
Seekers is inspired by the view that is held by mathematical realism, that mathematical entities objectively exist independently of the human mind. Therefore, mathematical entities are not constructed by humans, but rather, are discovered by humans. This means, that also other intelligent beings would be able to discover the same entities.

In 'seekers', a set of complicated, computer-generated functions are used to render coloured spaces on a Cartesian plane. The mathematical space is being explored and discovered by a group of seekers, which hover and fly around within the layers of infinitely evolving shapes. The vicinity of a seeker also modifies the surrounding mathematical space, which means that the seekers will never reach the objective reality.

The generating functions are created using human-curated evolutionary algorithm following the idea demonstrated already in Karl Sims' paper 'Artificial Evolution for Computer Graphics' in 1991.

———

Features 29 generative base functions, 15 palettes in various modes. Some palettes have a special 'dark mode', where the seekers also slightly illuminate the otherwise darkened space.

----

Notes for viewer:

- The piece adapts to all screen sizes, although a fixed size can be defined by url parameters.

- The piece is preferably viewed full-screen. The resolution can be adjusted for best performance.

- The piece can be paused and high-resolution stills can be exported for printing.

- Video clips can be exported in webm format. For a high-resolution video, frames should be batch exported as PNG-sequence and rendered in a video editing software.

----

Controls: 

- Number keys from [1] to [8] adjust the resolution
- [space] pauses animation
- [s] exports a PNG with the current resolution
- [x] starts and stops recording of a webm clip (25mbps)
- [i] toggles display of frame number and resolution

----

URL parameters:

- &width={WIDTH}&height={HEIGHT} explicitly sets the render resolution to {WIDTH}x{HEIGHT}. Resolution controls do not work when dimensions are explicitly set.

- &rec={start},{end} batch records frames starting from {start} and ending at {end}. Can also be used to record stills. For example, if you want a still export from frame 300 in resolution 5000x3000, you can start the piece with url parameters &width=5000&height=3000&rec=300,300

----

License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

Utilizes fxHash template by Karsten Schmidt
https://github.com/thi-ng/tpl-umbrella-fxhash
MIT License

Utilizes components from thi.ng umbrella by Karsten Schmidt
https://github.com/thi-ng/umbrella
Apache Software License 2.0

metadata.name: RGB Elementary Cellular Automaton #690
metadata.description:
Stephen Wolfram's Elementary Cellular Automaton where 3 different rules are drawn in the Red, Green and Blue color components of the image.

Rules are selected randomly among a pre-selection of 53 rules from which nice behaviors emerge.

Tokens can have a cell size in the [1; 20] range.

metadata.name: Waiting in Afton #30
metadata.description: One image for each day since I quit my job as a data engineer to work on art full-time. Looking out my back window each day and watching the seasons change.

metadata.name: Textile Bacteria #25
metadata.description:
Telar's code became self-aware and tried to escape. I built a containment unit. "Textile Bacteria" is the result.

--

The piece is based on the 1970's work of the British mathematician John Conway's "Conway's Game of Life" cellular automaton. To avoid bacteria from dying when one of the threads ends up entirely on top of the other the algorithm adds one pseudorandom artificial cross in the weaving feeding the creatures keeping at the same time the weave consistent.

- Left-click to feed dead bacteria.
- Use the arrow keys to flip between the face and the back of the fabric.
- Press 'SPACE' on your keyboard to pause/play. 
- Press 'ENTER' on your keyboard to rewind. 
- Press 'F' on your keyboard to toggle between full-screen and regular view. 
- Press 'S' on your keyboard to save it as a 36 megapixels print.

metadata.name: Schematics #78
metadata.description:
These recovered schematics seem to be alien in nature. The technology is beyond our grasp, be we can infer these schematics generate structures. The schematic itself is encoded in the same common mathematical language as the structures it generates.

Responsive Rendering

Schematics is coded using shaders, and renders instantaneously on any size screen. It is also GPU friendly, in that it will not consume any gpu resource after the first frame is rendered.  Since it is a shader, a gpu is recommended.

Keys: 

's' saves a png in the exact size of the screen.

metadata.name: BOOKEEHH 🔵🟣🟠🟡🟢⚪ #42
metadata.description:
THiSIS tHE BOKEkH FX!

50% chance to a circle or a cross form.
Check the fullscreen mode! Adaptive.
In fullscreen mode: /?size=1 change pixel density.

metadata.name: Mystic runes #N #40
metadata.description: p5js generative

metadata.name: LandWaves #228
metadata.description:
Reaction diffusion systems are mathematical representations of the behaviours of fluids that can be found in nature. A key characteristic of these systems is that the initial parameters are simple but the resulting process can be extremely complex. In LandWaves, pixel colours affect each other, line by line, from top to bottom. Frequencies of multiple oscillating sound waves are turning the brightness values of these pixels into sonic materia. 

This piece started as an experimentation in gallery spaces, then transformed over several different digital ecosystems, questioning their hyper-capitalist nature and mediated affordance.

Touch to listen

attributes.name: what
attributes.value: a lake in which every drop of water is a moon

metadata.name: chromadynamics #75
metadata.description:
click and drag to interact with the piece.

press "c" to capture a screenshot (you will be prompted for resolution).

metadata.name: Pseudopodia #28
metadata.description:
Pseudopods are small temporary growths used by micro-organisms for moving about or ingesting food. Here is an artistic depiction of many pseudopods as viewed under the microscope.

Be patient, there are 3 rather slow drawing passes, followed by a final quick pass. The drawing passes give the piece a 3-dimensional aspect.

Press "s" to save image as a .png file.

metadata.name: celebration! #328
metadata.description:
happy birthday, fxhash <3

#fxhashturnsone

50% percent of primary sales goes to the SavePakistan Flood Relief Fundraiser

metadata.name: Ries #389
metadata.description:
Ries is 500 sheets of paper. 
Ries is an cut-up text-artwork.
Ries is artwork generated by an algorithm based on seeded random numbers.
Ries is a digital artwork installed in 5 forms in exhibitions setting.
Ries is an NFT artwork. 

Ries is an artwork where I try bring together my experience of doing gallery exhibitions, my love for generative and copy machine art, DIY-punk aesthetics, NFT’s and chaos. 

The edition of Ries will be installed in different forms and collages in a gallery exhibition in Walden Kunstaustellungen in Berlin in July of 2022. Opening is at 8.7. 19.00, welcome if you are in Berlin.
/www.galerie-walden.de/

The seed idea for the project was the method of cut-up where a text (or something else) is cut into pieces and then rearranged to form something new. A modified Markov’s Chain algorithm makes a small text or a group of words from a pool of texts that include Art texts about cut up technique and generative art talk from tweets. These words form a visual bottom layer and then another layer of words samples the first, cutting it up and thus following the theme of the artwork.

Since the single iterations of the project are designed to be used in a collage, they come in various tone, density, detail and scale. One can test from the variations button and get a sense of what the generator produces. 

Controls in live view:
-Pressing  j exports the current image as jpeg
-Pressing  p  exports the current image as png

To change the detail level one can access the pixel density of render by adding ?pixDens=4 to the end of the URL in live view. You can of course you any number other than 4 also. I it renders just a black image, you have to lower the number, since it is then too large for WEBGL to render.

Designed to be best rendered on desktop Chrome.

Pricing info
22 tez - Includes a gallery shown, signed print sent to minter by mail or by telefax(!)
11 tez - A fair price for an artwork, also the minter can personally pick up a signed gallery shown print from the gallery, after the exhibition.
5 tez - 1/2 fair price
2 tez - bottom dollar

If you minted on lower tiers and would want a print, please contact the artist per twitter dm to “upgrade”. If you bought secondary, and would want a print, please contact the artist per twitter dm.

Features exist mostly to help with artwork pairing for the collectors.


Markov’s chain code core is based on Markov Me! By https://codepen.io/alexkramerbanjo , MIT License

Displacement shader based on the wonderful shader examples by Adam Ferris


The artist holds the right to use the whole edition of Ries for display purposes for future exhibitions without asking permission or notifying the owners of the NFT’s.

1.7.2022 in Berlin
Antti Pussinen

www.anttipussinen.net
www.twitter.com/antti_pussinen
www.instagram.com/anttipussinen

metadata.name: Reflections #69
metadata.description:
Reflections is a generative piece about four-fold symmetry and soft textures. Initially it was simply meant to be a successor to my very first Fxhash token ‘Furbol’, but it soon evolved into a lot more than that.

Press the down arrow key to save a .PNG of the token.

metadata.name: Vasar #N #81
metadata.description: Inspired by Victor Vasarely, Vasar is the first generative collection of Vyril.

metadata.name: Segments #390
metadata.description:
A continuous flowing motion of segmented cubes.

There is 5 routes for variations which is chosen by the 'Animation Type' variable. Each route then has it's own way to produce variety based on the random values injected into each.

Routes available (each is a type of noise used to change the animation of the cubes):
1. Waveform
2. Cellular
3. Voronoise
4. Polka Dots
5. Layers

Each route then has between 5 to 11 variables that will change the outcome of the overall look.

metadata.name: swarm #26
metadata.description: a swarm of swimming ethereal bodies, growing in number with each mint iteration.

metadata.name: Materia Fluida #172
metadata.description:
A real time endless generative animation in vanilla Javascript WebGL GLSL.

The GLSL shader generates a warped FBM noise and applies convolution kernels for the Unsharpen and Sobel operators. The Sobel operator provides both the magnitude and direction of the gradient, one is used to highlight edges, the other to achieve a shading effect.

The main parameters for the animation can be chosen with the fx(params) interface.
The minted iterations will differ as the noise generation is seeded via fxrand().

The animation can be rendered in fullscreen at 16/9, 9/16, or 1/1 aspect ratio.

Requires WebGl compatible browsers.


Parameters
----------
Palette
- select palette
Noise Scale
- zoom in the noise field
FBM Octaves
- choose how much octaves in the FBM [4, 5, 6, 7]
Speed
- speed of animation
Warp Kind
- select the warping method [five kind]
Coeff. Noise
- amount of the main noise field
Coeff. Unsharp
- amount of unsharp filter
Coeff. Sobel
- amount of edge highlight
Coeff. Gradient
- amount of shading effect
Grain
- amount of added grain noise


Interactivity
-------------
[1] 1080x1080 [2] 1920x1080 [3] 1080x1920
[4] 2160x2160 [5] 3840x2160 [6] 2160x3840
[f] Fullscreen

[z]/[x] => -/+ Contrast
[c]/[v] => -/+ Brightness
[r]     => Reset Contrast and Brightness

[s] Save a png in current resolution

metadata.name: pathFlow v3 #31
metadata.description:
created using p5.js
Animated edition

Twisted path with changing colors and overlapping. The line consists of six pieces, one after the other, to form a long and intertwined path

** params has a default values for change is only from fx(params)
